definition: to sit/to take a seat/to take (a bus, airplane etc)/to bear fruit/variant of 座[zuo4]
earth/dust/clay/local/indigenous/crude opium/unsophisticated/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

from/through/via/to follow/to obey/to engage in (an activity)/never (in negative sentence)/(Taiwan pr. [zong4]) retainer/assistant/auxiliary/subordinate/related by common paternal grandfather or earlier ancestor
to be situated/to be located (of a building)
(of a commanding officer) to keep watch/to oversee
to take the car, bus, train etc
to sit quietly/to meditate/to stage a sit-in
to sit in a circle/seated around (a narrator)
to be on an equal footing

sentences.english: After that, everybody pelted snowballs at anybody who was riding the sled.
sentences.chinese: 那之后，每个人都对著坐雪橇滑下来的人砸雪球。

sentences.english: which is the L train to Bedford.
sentences.chinese: 你要坐L线地铁到贝德福德下车。

sentences.english: Probably the most noticeable thing we would see is the big, important seat of the judge.
sentences.chinese: 最显眼的可能就是法官所坐的大靠背椅。

sentences.english: If you are in bed or sitting down, stay there.
sentences.chinese: 如果您是在床上或坐着，不要走动。

sentences.english: I tore up the note, got in the car and started driving.
sentences.chinese: 我撕毁遗书，坐到车里，发动引擎。

sentences.english: Do not be hasty when climbing, sit for a while if you get tired.
sentences.chinese: 登山的时候不能急，累了就小坐片刻。

sentences.english: The children were sitting round the table.
When you sit, be the stronghold of truth.
sentences.chinese: 当你坐着时，要做真理的保垒。

sentences.english: After all, sitting and waiting is how we made money from the subprime debacle.
sentences.chinese: 毕竟，我们如何从次贷崩溃赚钱就是坐着等待。

sentences.english: Gates sat through it silently for about an hour.
sentences.chinese: 盖茨坐了约一个小时，自始至终沉默不言。

sentences.english: The meditator in the photograph is sitting too low.
sentences.chinese: 图中的冥想者坐得太低。

sentences.english: Some played cards while others sat about a table and drank.
sentences.chinese: 一些人打牌，一些人围桌坐着喝酒。

sentences.english: Look. You're going to continue to sit next to him.
sentences.chinese: 听着，你得继续跟他坐一起。

sentences.english: But another part wonders what's next after sitting up straight.
sentences.chinese: 但另一部分又怀疑，坐端正之后又会发生什么呢？

sentences.english: Many arrange to fight in a sitting posture.
sentences.chinese: 许多人布置好可以坐着战斗的位置。

sentences.english: Well, I am just sitting in for him for a while.
sentences.chinese: 嗯，我只是替他代班，在这里坐一下。

definition: to take the car, bus, train etc
to sit properly/to sit up straight
to give up one's seat/to be seated
to get on or into (a bus, train, car etc)
rickshaw seat (Beijing dialect)/patron (of teahouse, cinema)/passenger (in taxi, rickshaw etc)
to get off or out of (a bus, train, car etc)
to transfer/to change trains, buses etc
